Comments_List: All about the research methods used in behavioral neuroscience--this course is exactly what it sounds like.
Thorough understanding of brain anatomy, action potentials, and electrophysiological methods in invertebrate preparations.

We learnt to identify anatomical structures of the sheep brain and the developmental origins of different regions and their functions. We also learnt different methods to discern what was causing behavioral observations.
Neuro anatomy, electrophysiology of neurons and action potentials, and tecniques for evaluating neuron activity in invertebrates

The labs were interesting and sometimes even fun to do. The lab reports were pretty annoying and Prof Nelson was very nitpicky about you providing the exact wording that he was looking for in your answers.
Very clear lectures, informative modules, and lab reports that help you learn the material.
Strengths: Workload was very manageable, and the exams were fair. Weaknesses: Very harsh grading and the lectures were often very informative but dry.

strengths: small class size, good hands on experience
weaknesses: would like to receive powerpoints after each class
This course is great! Couldve gotten more info on the final paper before it was assigned but besides that it was great
This is probably a more interesting lab class than other ones offered here. Also it's in the morning which is nice if you have practices in the afternoons.
Yes - if you're at all interested in neuroscience and hands-on experience, or really want a better understanding of action potentials, take this course.
No, I wouldnt recommend this course unless the student was very interested in behavioral neuroscience.
Yes, if students need a psychology lab course with a intimate class size.
I think that the content of the class is very interesting for anyone who is interested in behavioral neuroscience, but I would not recommend this class in general.
